course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Materials Characterization Method
course.description: This course will introduce a selected series of materials characterization methods with an emphasis on the characterization methods of nanomaterials, especially chemically processed nanomaterials. The characterization methods will include electron spectroscopies, electron microscopies, scanning probe microscopies, and optical, thermal, mechanical, scattering and diffraction methods. The course will provide a balanced mix of physical principles, application considerations, and practical examples of the characterization methods. For CHEM students and students with instructor's approval only
course.prerequisites: CHEM 2310 AND CHEM 2410

reviews.author: Winnie the Pooh
reviews.title: Content is difficult but the assessments are not hard
reviews.comment_content:
Content is hard and have a lot to memorise. Many graphs and instruments in ppt would be examined in midterm.
Post-midterm content is like an advanced version of the midterm content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Both professors are willing to answer all questions raised by students. I love prof Halpert, he is so humorous
reviews.comment_grading:
Mostly all in B range
Midterm is very straightforward and very easy if you recite all the ppt.
Plus, they tend to give very high marks for the final project.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm
1 final project (present + report)
3 homework (1 literature review, 1 about using software, 1 about calculation)
I think it is fair for a 4000level course

reviews.author: hkusttoxicjj
reviews.comment_content:
L1: introduction to nanomaterials
L2: Properties of materials (and nanomaterials)
L3: Nanocrystal synthesis
L3.5: Guest lecture (XRD) which will be covered in midterm exam
L4: Optical instrument eg UV-Vis
L5: Elemental analysis eg FAAS
L6: X-ray absorption spectroscopy
L7: X-ray emission spectroscopy
L8: UV and other near-band state measurements
L9: SEM
L10: TEM
L11: STM
L12: ATM
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Halpert does a good job in teaching. He explains the difficult concepts quite articulately. The only downside is that he speaks too fast so we do not have enough time to digest a concept before moving on to the next.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (all MC): 50%
Final project (report + presentation): 30%
Assignments: 20%

The grading is quite straightforward and aims to test your understanding of the characterisation methods. Assignments are mainly to introduce some software that helps with characterisation. If you have any questions concerning the assignment, you can always turn to the TA. He is really helpful.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments x 3
Midterm (which covers all materials ie L1 -L12)
Group project
Group report

To me, the workload is quite heavy. Although professor has walked us through the software (to be used in the assignments), it is still a bit tough to follow and further manipulate it. Also, it is difficult to comprehend a large amount of knowledge within around half a semester. Not to mention to be examined in the midterm.

reviews.author: cheeeeeeeeee
reviews.comment_content:
1. General introduction ofmaterials characterization(Chapter 1)
2. Scanning probe microscopies(Chapter 2)
3. Electron microscopies(Chapter 3).
4. Surface chemistry and characterization techniques(Chapter 4)
5. Photoelectron spectroscopies(Chapter 5).
6. X-ray absorption and emission spectroscopies(Chapter 6).
7.Optical characterization techniques(Chapter 7).
8.Thermal characterization techniques(Chapter 8)

Although I was not quite satisfied with Prof's teaching, I enjoyed learning different cutting-edge characterization techniques.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His teaching is not really clear, hard to grasp the important bits from whole bunch of materials on the lecture slides.

There are way too much stuffs written on the lecture note, which he does not even refer much in the lecture.
(Personally don't think it really worth going to lecture)

Felt I learned more doing written reports and preparing for presentation, which involved lots of lit review for me.
reviews.comment_grading:
40% 2 Essays ( More like lit review report) + Presentation
10% by homework (just asking question to TA via email)
50% final exam
Indeed only final exam grade was released, but felt the grading was good anyways.

For final, reviewing the final review question - which he will give is really  important because his exam questions are exactly same as those on the review sheet.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was not really heavy.
The content seems to be a lot, but do not need to do any calculation stuffs, just know some basics of each characterization techniques.
